'''''Gymnopilus chrysimyces''''' is a species of [[mushroom]] in the [[Cortinariaceae]] family.

==Medicinal==
In a study the  mushroom species, this species was shown to have [[hemagglutinins]]. The species showed activity towards rat [[erythrocytes]] while ''Lentinus squarrosulus'' showed activity towards guinea pig and mouse erythrocytes. The [[agglutination (biology)|agglutination]] of both species showed that both extracts have more than one hemagglutinin.<ref>{{cite journal |title=Hemagglutinating activity in extracts of mycelia from submerged mushroom cultures |journal=Applied and Environmental Microbiology |date=October 1982 |first=PC |last=Banjoree |author2=Ghosh, A.K. |author3=Sengupta, S.  |volume=44 |issue=4 |pages=1009–1011 |url=http://aem.asm.org/content/44/4/1009.full.pdf+html |format=PDF |url-status=live |accessdate=2013-09-11}}</ref>
